How big is the Arctic Ocean? The Arctic Ocean covers an area of 5,440,000 square miles (14,090,000 square km). It is the smallest of the world's oceans. It is five times larger than the largest sea, the Mediterranean, and little more than one-sixth the area of the Indian Ocean.
